intro: Dipcadi tortile, commonly known as the spiral lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
